function.name: dump
function.short: Outputs a human readable dump of the contents of the multivector (for debugging purposes).

long.para: dump(x) outputs the current signature of the argument, x, and also the multivector components, which can be used for debugging. The sizes of the components are shown.

examples.precode:
>> x = randm
x =
0.0038 e0 - 0.9163 e1 - 0.1382 e2 + 0.3758 e12
>> dump(x) Signature: 1 1 0
Multivector components: 1: [1 1] double 2: [1 1] double 3: [1 1] double 4: [1 1] double
